summary: Build a simple email-based sign-in flow: user enters email, receives a simulated 4-digit verification code shown in-app, enters code with error handling, then completes sign-in by providing name, address, and phone number.
architectural_notes: Real email/SMS sending and real Google OAuth are not supported; verification codes must be simulated in-app (displayed to the user).

existing_features.title: Update ONLY the two selected DOM elements (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/section[1]/ol[1]/li[1]/div[2]/div[1] and /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/section[1]/ol[1]/li[1]/div[1]/svg[1]) on the /account/login page so they implement an email-based sign-in flow: Step 1) user enters email; Step 2) app generates a simulated 4-digit code and displays it in-app; Step 3) user enters the code to verify; Step 4) after verification, collect required details (name, address, phone number) to complete sign-in.

Add validation and error handling within the selected elements for: invalid/empty email, incorrect verification code, and invalid/missing profile fields (name/address/phone). Provide user-facing error messages in English and allow retry/correction without leaving the page.

When the user completes verification and successfully submits required details (name, address, phone), mark the user as signed in using the existing session-based mechanism and navigate them to the profile page (or the existing post-login destination), clearing any active guest session and refreshing relevant cached queries.

Replace the selected SVG icon (XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/section[1]/ol[1]/li[1]/div[1]/svg[1]) to visually match the new email/code verification flow (e.g., mail/lock/check icon), ensuring it is consistent with the updated sign-in UI and does not reference Google branding.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement email-based sign-in with simulated 4-digit verification code, validation/error handling, and post-verification collection of name/address/phone.
